name: Hotel Union Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I won my stay at this hotel so can not comment on value for money. I would stay here again but only when the rooms have all been refurbished which i understand is happening later on this year. We did get a glimpse of one of the reburbished rooms
reviews.title: Friendly staff and nice central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007
reviews.text: and it was lovely. Unfortunately we were in a smaller room with not a lot of natural light so it seemed very dark. But on the plus side its in a great location especially for shopping and cable cars, the staff are really helpful and you get free wine every evening! There's also car parking facilities. I think how great your stay here is definately depends on the type of room you are given.
reviews.title: Below expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We have been staying at this hotel for 2 nights mid of september. Although the location is great as you are in the heart of SAF, we have been disappointed by the level of quality of this hotel. It presents itself as a cute boutique hotel which is how it looks on the website, however the reality is not. Room was tiny, deco was average, cleaning was it is minimum levels. It depends what you are looking for in yuor trip but don't expect to stay in a real boutique hotel, you will be disappointed as we were.
reviews.title: Dirty, Dark, & Stank! Avoid Room 429

likes.disliked: — Room was dingy and run down and extremely small.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't believe I booked this room at a rate of $189.00 per night.. I must have had the same room as the reviewer from Germany. The staff was nice enough but this place smelled horrible, had ratty bedding, and no air conditioning. Noisy room with a view of a brick wall. Since there's no air conditioning all windows in hotel were open which allowed for cigarette smoke, sirens, and other guests noise to float right into my room. If you are a woman traveling alone I would avoid this place. The doors were not very secure and there was so little staff in the lobby there's no way they had any real security. This place was so bad I left after the first night and moved into the San Fransico Marriott a few blocks away.
reviews.title: Cute hotel in the middle of everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel is right in the middle of all the action. The lobby is simple and probably true to its original form. They have nightly wine hours in this lobby. The hallways are long and narrow, like an old apt building. Our room was facing the main road, but it was surprisingly quiet. The bathrooms are clean, which makes me very happy. It's a great place if you don't need a lot of space, and are looking more for location than luxury.
reviews.title: No complaints, quite a few compliments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel Union Square for one night in Feb. 07. It was a last minute business trip and this was the only hotel available near the Moscone Convention Center (about a 10-15 minute walk). The hotel was described to me by a co-worker as “boutique-y”, which is a nice way of saying that it’s not quite what I’m used to. My room was very small, and the shower in the bathroom was downright tiny. The furnishings were kind of funky and cool, but the walls/doors are not sound proof at all. I could here every alarm clock, phone call, TV, etc. from everyone on the hall, so a good night’s sleep was out. It reminded me of some of the older hotels I’ve stayed at in Europe (and that's not really a good thing).
reviews.title: Good price, but...

likes.liked: — Walking distance to a lot of restaurants and shopping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The one bright spot was the lobby. The décor is cool, there was complimentary wine at happy hour, and the belldesk was very helpful with directions.
reviews.title: Great Service with Character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location and ambience, but outstanding service is what made the stay special. Tom Steele, the concierge, was fantastic helping out with some complex business arrangements and was spot on with dinner recommendations during a very busy week. The housekeeping was fabulous as well. The bathroom absolutely sparkled each day. Noise mentioned in other reviews was a complete non-issue anywhere other than the very front of the hotel. You'd have to expect some noise streetfront in one of the busiest spots in the city, wouldn't you?
reviews.title: Don't Bother
Great Hotel, Awesome Location
reviews.text: Our stay at this hotel was one of the worst hotel experiences that I have had in a long time. When we got there we were given a room on the 2nd floor directly next to a room that was under renovation. The contractors banged, sawed and let profanities fly until 6 PM that evening. They finally left after we complained to the staff that we had had enough and would like to lie down and try to relax a bit before dinner. This was after the power to our room was cut off so the electrician could wire the outlets next door. Additionally, the heat in our room didn't work and the bed was as hard as a rock. As we finally got to sleep early in the morning hours, there were patrons running and shouting through the hallways. I would rate my experience on par with my days back in the college dormitory. When we checked out, I was expecting an apology or maybe even an adjustment on the hotel rate but nothing. Never again would I stay or recommend anyone to stay at this hotel. Too bad since the location is awesome.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Great Small Hotel, Very Neat and clean, They have an awsome Kids Suite. The suite is decorated in Primary colors, complete with childrens table set up for coloring and games. Acomputer is available for the children to watch movies or play games as well. the adults area contained two double beds and a T.V. Very comfortable decor and beds. The hotel location is awesome closed to Trolly turnaround, the metro and just a block from Union Square.
reviews.title: Good for the price but noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was dreadful. We had a corner room and the door to our room was opaque so you could see the outline of us if we stood near the door. I was so worried that the place may have had bed bugs that we place all our luggage on the bathroom sink and the toilet. The window in the bathroom (if you can call it a bathroom - it was sooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo small) was open and could not be shut. I have stayed in some cleaner backpackers than this place. Read my other reviews, I am not a real fussy person - but this was just dreadful!
reviews.title: More like a brothel than a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a reservation for 4 nights, we checked out after just one night.
reviews.title: OK for a short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We used the hotel for a three-night stopover in San Francisco. We left early every day for sightseeing and arrived back late. It was just somewhere to sleep and it served that purpose OK, although there was a lot of street noise at night. Garbage collection and drunken behaviour outside was intrusive.
reviews.title: Excellent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: The location is good as a base for exploring the city. Our room was clean enough, but dated and shabby, and had just enough storage for our purposes. It was a corner room overlooking the Cable Car terminus at Powell Street, which added a touch of character and was OK for a couple passing through, but I wouldn't want to use it for a longer stay or with children.
reviews.title: What a Nightmare!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was a problem. We didn't find any local diners open before eight in the morning and ended up getting sandwiches from the shop across the street. We did not take advantage of the complimentary morning coffee or evening wine. On the day of departure we breakfasted at Lori's Diner across the street which was an amazing 1950's-again experience.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just returned home and I can't wait to share my good time in Union Square Hotel. It was my last destination in
reviews.title: You must stay there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: San fran of my around the world trip. Budget accommation must be my target as money shouldnt have left much. Price of
reviews.title: Very THIN walls...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: union was relatively cheaper than in Sydney three stars hotel (I am working in three stars hotel, so I am quite informative in prices and quality ). With the cheap price offered, i would not expect much more than a bed for a good sleep. Suprisingly, it is much higher than my expectation.
reviews.title: Can't wait to come back
Good Down-Town Budget Hotel
reviews.text: Easy to find, got the Bart from the Airport, short walk up Powell Street to Hotel. Very friendly welcome from Reception, offered a noisy or quiet room, went for the quiet option. Room was adequate, Purple Doors must be a San Franciso thing! Bathroom could do with a bit of TLC, but was kept very clean.

reviews.title: Sleepless in San Francisco
reviews.text: Stayed for three nights, enjoyed the Wine early evening as was the Tea & Coffee in the morning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our family of four spent a couple of holiday nights at your hotel and we loved its proximity to the trollies, the best shopping in SF, and excellent choices in food. The Hotel Union Square is a really neat old downtown hotel with a very modern feeling. The people-watching from above Powell St. is an added bonus. The staff was great and we enjoyed our stay very much!
reviews.title: Where the action is!

likes.disliked: — A quiet getaway place this is not

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Tyners
reviews.title: Close to it ALL!

likes.disliked: — price for parking for hotel guests-$$$$

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ventura, CA
reviews.title: Cute, cheap, close to the action...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well, my boyfriend and I had just come from a beautiful resort in Napa so this place was a change in scenery. Although the room was small, with thin walls and no view there were many other things that made up for this. We literally walked out of the hotel into the action of Powell St., the hotel included a small "special package" for us with bottled water, nice lotions, hair rubberbands, sample Emergen-C, toothpastes, deodorant, etc... Nothing huge but I like free stuff! :) The staff was friendly and there was hotel parking lot in the back! No walking down the streets with luggage!
reviews.title: location doesn't make up for the insolence, noise, fake perks, etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: You guessed it... its an old hotel with thin walls, and there will be some noise from the street (you do know this hotel is on the cable car turn around, don't ya). If you need a little more peace and quiet, book a courtyard room... you won't hear much street noise from there.
reviews.title: light, airy, noisy - loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (sorry I'm a little late for this)
reviews.title: Great location. Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a little trouble at check in, getting the room we booked, but I believe it was mainly because the guy was new. We had to go back down, to get moved to the proper room, but the manager stepped in and fixed us up right away.
reviews.title: Great location for the price

likes.liked: — The front desk staff and concierge and location to great restaurants
likes.disliked: — Housekeeping coming into our room when we said do not disturb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: We had a corner suite room for $169/nt+tax (Sun&Mon). It was Humongous! An incdredibly large room (see pics), with an outstanding view of the street cars. It's and older hotel, but we found it had lots of charm. The street car noise did not bother us at all. We thought it was pretty cool, hearing the street car bells ringing. Again, you can't beat the price for that kind of a location!
reviews.title: TERRIBLE, Just Horrible!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: Plus, there is a very, very, very large shoe store just across the street! (I like spoiling my girl! I think she got 4 or 5 pairs this trip..... not shown in the picture :)
reviews.title: Nostalgia buffs would love this place. It could use some updating

likes.disliked: — Worn out and tired apperance of the building and area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is right in the middle of everything in Union Square and seems like it might not be so nice from the outside. However, inside, it is nicely remodeled and appointed. Our room had a comfy bead, cushy carpets, and modern Pottery Barn type furniture. There was also a flat screen TV and an iPod dock with speakers. The bathroom was just large enough. We stayed on the 2nd floor facing the inside of the hotel and we never heard anything going on in Union Square. We couldn't even hear the trolleys.
reviews.title: Nicely Appointed Rooms, but Walls Too Thin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: However, the walls between the rooms are too thin. We could hear EVERYTHING going on next door to us. I think that our neighbors bed was placed right behind our bed. However, we might have just been unlucky that we got placed next to such uh...vocal...people.
reviews.title: Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you want to stay in Union Square, this is a great place. The people at the front desk are very nice and accommodating and I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Very nice little boutique style Hotel
reviews.title: Nice try

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: good central location
reviews.title: Great Location/Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I needed a hotel close to the Moscone Convention Center. When this popped up in a search, at about half the price of most of the surrounding facilities, I was intrigued and a little bit leary. The reviews here and elsewhere didn't really calm my fears. But, for three nights and with few other options within a reasonable budget, I decided to take a chance.
reviews.title: Worked well for me
Do yourself a favour... stay elsewhere
reviews.text: When I was there, only a couple of floors had rooms open while renovations continue on the upper floors. My room on the second floor was small by contemporary American standards (and included only a small nightstand and an empty armoire with just enough space to walk around the bed). But this is, after all, a very old building and the space was fine for one or two people if you're not spending a lot of time in the room (and why would you in San Francisco?). I've seen similarly sized rooms in older hotels in NYC and European cities, so I guess size perception is a matter of location and expectations. And some of the rooms are larger (a colleague who traveled with me had much more space).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The bathroom was about average size and the closet was actually somewhat spacious, although there was no dresser or drawers in the armoire so I wound up leaving some of my clothes in my suitcase on the rack in the closet. Again, it was okay by myself but would have been an irritant if my wife had been traveling with me.
reviews.title: Would not return

likes.liked: — nothing except front desk people were good
likes.disliked: — rooms were not attractive or repaired properly, no attention to detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was not overlooking the street, which may explain why it was relatively quiet at night. Morning was another story...renovation work began about 7 a.m. most mornings, lots of banging. On a work trip, I was up anyway. If I'd been on vacation, I probably would have been out of there after the first night.
reviews.title: A mixed bag

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly, and helpful with the couple of small questions I asked.
reviews.title: The wrong room will do you in
A Gem Of A Hotel
reviews.text: This is my second stay at the Hotel Union Square and both times were delightful. The rooms are very comfortable and come with loads of goodies. The parking is very easy and the staff is always welcoming and helpful. The most surprising thing is how quiet it is and the relaxed feeling you get as soon as you enter the tastefully decorated lobby. Surprising because this little hotel sits right in the heart of San Francisco's shopping district - within easy walking to many stores, great restaurants and entertainment. I look forward to my next stay at Hotel Union Square.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our travel agency in Brussels booked us into this hotel and was too late to change. After listening to the advice of other members, we decided to ask for the room facing the courtyard on the upper floor. The room we were given was on the top floor (6th floor) Room no. 622 (?) standard room with double bed . It is very small and the bathroom is very old fashion and dim. The bed is small but comfortable.
reviews.title: Lots of compromise for great location

likes.disliked: — no privacy and old fashioned and dim bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is no net curtain and if you open the curtain, people in the opposite room or in the hallway can see directly into your room. If you draw the curtain, it is dark as the curtain is rather thick. There is no air conditioned but fortunately in late June it is not too hot.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay overall.
Hated it !
reviews.text: Location is excellent and staff are friendly. However the concierge double as bell boy is very snotty.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I passed by a twin room on the same floor - it is big and rather nice.
reviews.title: Kids Suite Rocks!

likes.liked: — One of the few places you can book a family of 5 into one room in central San Francisco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We weren't sure what to expect as this was our first time in San Francisco. The hotel lobby doesn't look a lot like the website picture (a lot smaller than it appeared) so our first impressions were a little disappointing. However it got better from then on. Our room on the 5th floor was plenty big enough for 4 of us (but again we're used to British and European rooms which are generally smaller than in the US) and recently renovated - a modern look with stripped brick, flat screen TV etc. The bathroom was a little pokey but perfectly adequate. This is an old building so it's going to be a bit dark but they're doing a good job of remodelling. NB at the time of our stay this renovation was still unfinished and 2 floors were a building site; we didn't find this too intrusive but some might. It also made keeping the dust down a nightmare for the cleaners.
reviews.title: Really good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Position-wise we loved being right in the heart of town. It was a bit noisy but what do you expect in the centre of a buzzing city like San Francisco? If you want a quiet retreat this isn't for you. It's right next to the Powell cable car turn-around and ideal for restaurants and shopping around Union Square, as well as museums such as SFMOMA and the Cartoon Museum. The staff were attentive, Tom the concierge was particularly helpful and the room was always clean.
reviews.title: A Diamond In The Rough!

likes.liked: — The hotel itself and it's location!
likes.disliked: — Nothing, it was all very nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Negatives? The room had precious little clothes storage space for a family of 4 - it just needed a chest of drawers (which there was plenty of room for). We've mentioned this to the hotel and they've assured us this will be acted upon - only time will tell.
reviews.title: Never AGAIN

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, though, I'd definitely recommend this hotel if you want to be in the heart of the city. We were very relieved to be staying here rather than, say, Fisherman's Wharf, which is tourist hell (and that's with 2 children - they loved their stay here); for it's location it's brilliant value.
reviews.title: We enjoyed our stay
Blech!!
reviews.text: We had some sort of weird bathroom it may have been for disabled people? Im not sure.

reviews.title: Great Location..Ask for courtyard facing room.
reviews.text: Our travel agent booked this one for us and I think here in lies the problem, they dont have to try as hard when theyre in all the travel agent broshures.

reviews.title: Great Value Overall, Would stay there again
reviews.text: I looked this hotel up on trip advisor before we left for our trip and wasnt sure about it, I wish Id gone with my instincts and booked somewhere else...

reviews.title: Fabulous location but poor room sizes
reviews.text: Hotel Union Square Date: 10th Sept 07

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Reviewer: Carol - London UK.
reviews.title: Awful -- One Star is Too Many

likes.disliked: — Comfort, cleanliness, computer access, furnishings, air conditioning-- all substandard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apologies for late review. Arrived from UK looking forward to our stay in the Hotel Union Square especially after seeing their website, extremely disappointed. We asked for a non smoking and quite room, we got room 425 on the 4th floor overlooking the car park, refuse to take this room, you could not swing a mouse let alone a cat in that room, it was the smallest closet I have ever seen, and the bathroom was smaller that a cruise bathroom. My husband immediately went to see about changing rooms, they then offerred us room 415 on the same floor - the bathroom was larger, the closet was walk in but still small just enough to put the cases in, but the room was still small, we had no drawer space hence had to live out of our cases. The coffee machine was on the top of the TV, but to make coffee the machine had to be placed on the floor because the flex wire did not reach the plug socket. The view from our bedroom was another guest's room, our windows were opposite each other so when they were in we had to close our curtains. The reception staff were helpful and friendly. But the location is excellent and right in the centre of everything. On leaving the hotel I asked how many of the rooms they had like the one on the website and the picture by the lift, the receptionist told me that they were doing up the rooms and the website is very misleading to guest booking that hotel. Would not ever go there again. The Trading Standards dept in San Francisco should investigate this hotel as it is totally misleading people who book this hotel.
reviews.title: Sufficient for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Union Square is a zero-star establishment. This property is an antiquated dump in an excellent location. Untiil the hotel is renovated, don't waste your time or money.
reviews.title: Tiny rooms, Great location

likes.disliked: — If the rooms were a little larger, they would be more comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the Hotel Union Square at $189/night because it was recommended in connection with a conference, because it was centrally located, and because the hotel's website presented it as a boutique hotel.
reviews.title: Their website is DECEPTION

likes.disliked: — reality is a let-down from the illusion created by their website

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Hi
reviews.title: I thought it was not so bad

likes.disliked: — Cheap linen on the beds and no net curtains

description: •Complimentary morning coffee & tea in the lobby•Complimentary evening wine reception
